result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:15 AM Defendant Charles Jeremy Epperson in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Charles Jeremy Epperson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State advises the court that prior to going on the record was informed a waiver.
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No violent or abusive contact with Essentia staff. No use or possession of alcohol.

3:07 PM Defendant Charles Jeremy Epperson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Hoffman appears with Defendant. Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court cals case.  Address verified as Solid Rock. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty, asks for prelim. Court accepts plea. 
State requests $750 cash, with conditions of no violent or abusive contact with personnel at Essentia, no use or possession of alcohol. Cites priors and prior FTA's. 
Attorney Hoffman indicates recent resident of Douglas County, previously in Minnesota. No money to post. 
Court makes statements. Court orders $750 cash, with conditions of no violent or abusive contact with personnel at Essentia, no use or possession of alcohol.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
